turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Call me Irish, but I don't believe in cooler heads prevailing.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Acheson's scenario is unacceptable. And he has more experience than anyone.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: There is no expert on this subject, no wise old man.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Cheer up, you've neutralized the entire White House Press Corps for a day.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Have you canceled Chicago and the rest of the weekend yet?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: You don't show for Chicago, everyone'll know there's something going on.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: I don't care. Cancel it.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: I'm not calling and canceling on Daly. You call and cancel on Daly.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: You're scared to cancel on Daly.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Damn right I'm scared.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: We have to try the blockades. It probably won't work. It may just be delaying the inevitable. But we can't just go to war without trying not to.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: I don't know. I don't know.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: You'd worry that something was wrong if Congress offered you unconditional support.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: They want this fucking job, they can have it. It's no great joy to me.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: I don't like what's happening.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: In the morning I'm taking charge of the blockade from the situation room. McNamara'll set up shop in the flag plot at the Pentagon, keep an eye on things there.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: All right. 'Cause you get armed boarders climbing into Soviet ships, shots being fired across bows...

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: I know, I know...

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: What about these low-level flights? They're starting in what? An hour? Do you realize what you're letting yourself in for?

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: We need those flights. We have to know when those missiles become operational, because when they do, we need to destroy them.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Fair enough. But Castro's on alert and we're flying attack planes over their sites, on the deck. There's no way for them to know they're carrying cameras, not bombs. They're going to be shot at, plain and simple.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: I'm your political advisor, and I'm giving you political analysis here. This is a setup. The Chiefs want to go in. It's the only way they can redeem themselves for the Bay of Pigs. They have to go in, and they have to do it right. It's that simple.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: I'm gonna protect those pilots.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: How does a man get to a place where he can say, 'throw those lives away,' so easily?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Maybe it's harder for them to say it than they let on. At the very least, they believe it's in our best interest. And at the end of the day, they may end up being right.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: That's going to be tough. You know how these guys are about their chains of command...

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Any problems, you remind them those chains of commands end at one place. Me.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: We can horsetrade with Khruschev on ships. But it doesn't get us any closer to removing those missiles.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Have to hope it's a signal that he'll back down on the real issue too.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: He's right, we can't rescind DEFCON 2. The Soviets will think we've gotten sweet on them.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: And we can't purge the Chiefs. Our invasion talk will look like a bluff. Or even that there's been an attempted coup.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Oh, just a bunch of crap about withdrawing our Jupiter missiles in Turkey if the Soviets'll do the same in Cuba.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: I don't want to listen to this again.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: If we made a trade, we'd be giving in to extortion, and NATO would never trust us again. We'll get clobbered in world opinion.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: It's a goddman trial balloon. Trial is the operative word, here.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Then somebody'd better deny it publicly.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Jesus Christ, O'Donnell, you're the one saying we need to move forward on a political solution.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Yeah, a good political solution.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Didn't know Adlai had it in him. Too bad he didn't have this stuff in '52.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Zorin must not have gotten instructions. Somebody in their Foreign Ministry's blown it big-time.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: I've got to move. What do you have, Kenny?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: They know each other! Khruschev and Feklisov aka Fomin were war buddies!

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: You're sure...

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Don't take it to court, but we've got good circumstantial evidence...  Walter agrees. My gut's telling me Khruschev's turning to a trusted old friend to carry his message.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Okay, Ken. We're going.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: We give them something. We tell them we'll remove the missiles from Turkey say, six months from now so that there appears to be no linkage. We also tell them if they go public about it, we deny it and the deal is off.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: And we do it under the table so we can disavow any knowledge of it.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Moving the line. Stroke of genius.

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: Of course it is. But the President needs to realize we're going to have to stop a ship eventually.

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: You must think I'm blind and stupid. I've already gotten the birds and bees from Bobby. The President doesn't have to double-barrel me.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Listen to me, goddamn it. We're talking about a possible nuclear war. You dropped the ball on Bay of Pigs --

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: -- you sonofabitch, goddamn it, I didn't drop --

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: You were in the room. It was your purview. It was your job to make sure Bissel wasn't fucking us over and you didn't do it. You've got the most important job in the world right now. You're the smartest guy the President has.  Besides me.

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: At least it will expose whether Khruschev has been overthrown. We'll know what we're dealing with.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: And if this is a move to appease the hard line, then it may just be the bone he needs to regain control of his own house.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Dangle a settlement, tie us down in negotiations, we come up short...

turns.speaker: MCCONE
turns.text: Why else would they approach us in this way? It's deniable. The Soviets have done nothing but lie to us. This could be more of the same.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: That may be why Khruschev's introducing this guy. We've been burned by his usual players in the formal channels, so he brings in an honest broker.

turns.speaker: MCCONE
turns.text: That may be what they want us to think.

turns.speaker: MCCONE
turns.text: My specialists are in agreement: this morning's letter is not Khruschev. Last night's letter was.  The evidence supports only one conclusion: there has been a coup, and Khruschev was replaced overnight.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Jesus Christ...

turns.speaker: MCCONE
turns.text: It's transparent. The press'll be all over it.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Six months from now, I'm not going to care. Are you? We'll deal with it.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Bob. Bet you had a late night.

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: Sleep is for the weak, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Bob?

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: We've worked up several military scenarios. Before I ask General Taylor to lead us through the various options, I'd like for us to adopt a rule. If we are going to strike, we must agree now that we will do it before the missiles become operational. Because once they are, I don't think we can guarantee getting them all before at least some are launched.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Bob, is there any way we can avoid stopping a submarine first?

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: I'm afraid not, Mr. President. The sub has positioned itself between the Pierce and the Soviet ships. Admiral Anderson insists it's too much of a risk to proceed with stopping the freighters. The Pierce would be a sitting duck for the sub.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Captain, force the sub to the surface for inspection.

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: Mr. President! We're receiving reports that the ships are stopping!

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Captain, belay that order!  Bob, where's that coming from!

turns.speaker: MCNAMARA
turns.text: Just a second, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
turns.text: Will somebody find out what's going on?!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey. Nice tie.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Don't get too attached.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're my hero, Carl.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Heroes ain't supposed to shake. I'm shakin', man, look at me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Breathe, Carl. Four, nice, deep ones.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Anyone stops us going in, we're with the Bowen-Hamilton Textile Company. We have rug samples.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Rug samples.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We are one-dimensional, boring peddlers of fine carpet, Carl.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Larry, what the fu-- Larry. That's not even your name, is it? What's your real name, you fucking scumbag?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't have one, Carl. I have a number, man. Just like the numbers on those treasury checks. You stole from your own country, Carl. Shame on you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I thought we were staying on the reservation.

turns.speaker: CLEAR MOON
turns.text: Yes. Rooms thirteen and fourteen are on Indian land.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: CLEAR MOON
turns.text: Are you hungry? I have some nice raw kidney in the truck.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Oh, I'm set, Sir. I'm set.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Mr. Clear Moon.

turns.speaker: CLEAR MOON
turns.text: Our police are afraid of them. Please get them out of here.

turns.speaker: CLEAR MOON
turns.text: They're going to kill me next. That's what I hear. These new Indians are destroying everything. Our people are a quiet people.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They can lead us to Jimmy. Just let them go. We're tightening the net on him. We know he's on the reservation.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Now keep that between us, Dennis, cuz I don't know what kinda Johnny Law they got here.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Hey, Brooks, come over here. I want you to meet a coupla fellas from Denver.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Brooks, what's a perceptive fellow like you, doing in a joint like this? Let me buy you a glass of some of that Russian shit you like.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: FBI? What you investigatin'?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: A murder. On the reservation.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Again. Figures, man.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You know how in your big cities, you got your niggers and you got your Puerto Ricans? Well out here we got Indians. That's just the way it is.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: The only good Indian is a dead Indian, does that old adage still hold true out here?

turns.speaker: LOOKS TWICE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: James Looks Twice?

turns.speaker: LOOKS TWICE
turns.text: That's right. What are you doing here? This is a religious ceremony you're desecrating.

turns.speaker: LOOKS TWICE
turns.text: What's this about?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Your good friend Leo Fast Elk.

turns.speaker: LOOKS TWICE
turns.text: You think I killed him? Cuz he was an apple? Well, let me tell you something about Leo, Man --

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: -- don't "man" me, Jimmy. Where's the key?

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: Levoi, Cooch. Raymond Levoi, Criminal Division.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Oh, yeah -- right.

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: Interesting bloodline you have, Ray.  French, Scots-Irish, Italian, ...and one-eighth American Indian.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Sioux Indian, right?

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: Ray, there's been a homicide out in an area known as The Badlands. Indian Reservation.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: It's not the first. There's been several. And our field office in Rapid City is getting a lot of heat... none of the investigations have turned up jack shit.

turns.speaker: TULLY
turns.text: The main problem is, Ray, these people are extremely distrustful of outsiders, non-Indians. Relations have not been amicable.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Different culture. Hard to penetrate. The Indians don't like white cops poking around. And that's why we're in a position where we have to bring in an American Indian agent.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Taking ol' Leo somewhere?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Leo's been out here too long, man. I'm taking him to ceremonial burial.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Nice piece. You come back here to cover your tracks, Geronimo? What's your name?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: It ain't Geronimo.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: I think maybe you guys got off the wrong exit, yeah? This is the Bear Creek Indian Reservation.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: I know where I am. I'm on federal land, doing a federal investigation, and if you don't wanna cooperate you can take a ride in a federal car, and spend the rest of the day in a little room, answering federal questions. It's your call. Who are you?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: I'm a full blood Oglala Sioux, born and raised on this reservation.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: You're a wise-ass. Ray check his wallet.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: We got the wire ya was comin'. You're the Indian official, yeah?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: No. No, that's Ray, here. Ray, uh...  Ray... Little Weasel.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Leo's gotta get to burial, Brother. He's gotta make the journey.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: What journey?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Tell him, Ray.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: -- an Indian Reservation is within the jurisdiction of the Federal Bureau of Intimidation. I know that.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Good. Thank you.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Somebody must be doing something somewhere in your jurisdiction, Officer Crow Foot.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You ain't gonna cut his hands off and send 'em to Washinton, are ya? They done that to one of our girls once. Leo did quillwork, he's gonna need his hands.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Respect the dead, Hoss. Because when --

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: -- did you understand me when I said that --

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: -- violation of the Major Crimes Act on an Indian Reservation is within the jurisdiction of the Federal Bureau of Instigation. I know that.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: What the hell you doing?!

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: His mother needs a piece of his hair. It's for the Keeping of the Souls Ceremony.  Has to be kept for four days.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: South Dakota...  Did I do something unsatisfactory, Sir?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: No, Ray. You're gonna have to blame that on your grandmother.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I didn't know him, Sir. He passed away when I was six.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Seven.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Those are two agents who went into a reservation a few years ago to serve a warrant. They were executed at close range. That one there is a police officer killed by the Mohawks up in Canada more recently.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: The agents who have worked out here say its like going into Nam. Unfamiliar terrain, foreign language, foreign customs... and you never know when you might walk into a few rounds. They hold a lot of old anger for the white man out here.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Were you in Nam?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Airborne. That's where they used to get us agents from. Now we get 'em from Carnegie-Melon, Ivy League. Accountants and computer whiz-kids. Yuppies with guns.  That's scary shit.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Hey, hey, hey. J. Edgar would've loved you. He'd love anybody who joined the bureau to, what was it? "To enforce the laws of my country and protect her interests"?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You crashed my file?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: No. I consulted it. We're going into Indian Country, I wanna know what kind of individual is covering my ass. Don't you?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Six rounds. 357.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: That's what it looks like, doesn't it? But that's what a ten gauge, choke-bored, shotgun will look like when it hits your lower back from five feet away.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Somebody was serious about doing this guy, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: This is a restricted area.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Check him out, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Who the fuck is he?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: -- a fucking cop.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Leo has to take the journey, Cooch.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: We'll have to give Leo a refund. Because he's gotta go to the M.E. In case you don't know, Officer, violation of the Major Crimes Act on --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Leo's gonna need his hands, Cooch. He does quillwork.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: I think Leo's retired from quillwork for the moment.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Keeping of the souls. Do they still burn their dead or something?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Beats the hell outta me.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: No. That's Ray here. Ray...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Ray Levoi, Sir. Pleasure.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Water. Worth killing for out here, I'd think.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Get the plate numbers off everyone of these cars.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I already did.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Couldn't sleep.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Maisy Blue Legs place?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How'd you know?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: I got one up on ya.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: I've got the doer. I know who he is.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Meet me at base. Over.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cooch. You're my hero.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: One of the leaders of the Warriors of All Red Nations. Militant organization.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: White eagle feather through the circle. That's their symbol.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They obviously wanted it to be known that they offed Leo. Some kind of statement.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Jimmy Looks Twice put Leo's head through a glass door of the tribal offices three months ago. And threatened him several times since. President Clear Moon and the regional FBI feel he made good on that threat.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'd just like five minutes alone with the motherfucker who hung that flag upside down.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Easy, Cowboy. No vendettas on my ship. Now: remember what I told you about Nam? Watch the grass, watch the trees, watch the shit house, be on your toes, and if we get committed, don't hesitate to empty that sucker.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Alright. Alright.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: What'd she say?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: She talks a lot of shit. We're not doing our job. Jimmy's innocent. "What's the FBI really doing here." Some shit about the Fort Laramie Treaty.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: She took something from the house. What she called a medicine bundle. Most likely Jimmy's.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Let's see it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I gave it back to her.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: That's good goddamn work, Ray. Let the salmon run. Let 'em run Upriver.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Why we setting Eagle Bear up as an informant?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Her own people start to suspect her, it creates discord from within. The Warriors don't know who to trust, they start infighting, and Jimmy loses his support.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Her oil pan is shot.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cooch. What's the Fort Laramie Treaty?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Jesus, I don't know. You tell me. You're the Indian.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Cooch.  Where the fuck did they send us?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: A long way from home. You be careful out there.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: The right man? Talk to me, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Whoever dusted Leo, dusted him from the driver's seat of a moving car then drove those eight miles to the Badlands. Jimmy Looks Twice has never been behind the wheel of a car. It's a known fact out here that he's petrified of driving. His parents were killed in a car wreck.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Genetic ditto on evidence found at the site with evidence you found in his belongings. An incontrovertible motive. And definite footprints on Jimmy Looks Twice at Maisy Blue Legs house.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: When did we get that?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Today. And now you -- there's a dog in the van --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: -- I know. I fed it, and I can't get rid of --

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: You weren't sent here to go off on your own detail, Ray. You were sent here to assist in a Selective Operations Unit. These regional agents are inept -- that's why they were sent out here to The Graveyard, to Indian Country. I need you behind me, Ray. Not pulling against me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not trying to pull against you, Cooch. I've just been having nightmares about the way Leo was killed.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Your first homicide, that's gonna happen, Ray...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I just wanna make sure no one else gets done in that way because we were in bed with the wrong doer.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Ray. I never get into bed with somebody unless I know for sure. Just the way I was raised.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Alright. Alright...

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Yeah, alright, alright -- fuck you -- give a yuppie a badge and he wants to take over the world. Go get a tail on Eagle Bear, and stay with her. Cuz Jimmy's gonna show. And I want you to make the collar.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: I'll sleep around a little.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Thanks, Cooch.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: And get rid of the dog.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Bastards...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: All I could think of was... not here. I don't wanna eat it on an Indian Reservation, three thousand miles from home.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: He's out there. He's out there playing Sitting Bull with us. I want the motherfucker so bad I'm getting a bleeding ulcer.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It may have been Maggie's way of saying "get off my ass."

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: She's that subtle?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Eagle's claws and a bear's balls that's what her profile says.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Well, she's running now, too. These fucking people like to run, don't --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: -- Cooch. Woh. Stop.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Tread matches. It's the car.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: And it was full of water when I drove by here three days ago. Full. I mean... a river.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: The Little Walking River. You're right. This is part of it. So whoever sunk this car didn't compensate for drought. Goddamn.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Jesus, you alright?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah. I... I fell asleep. I can't believe it. I --

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Never turn your radio off! I thought I was gonna find you scalped! Damn it!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sorry, Cooch. I lost Eagle Bear --

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: -- never mind Eagle Bear. We've got Jimmy nailed. Let's go!

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Listen: when we get back tomorrow, you're gonna find Tully laying a promotion on you. S.A.C. He wants to prove that his yuppie agents are making good. He's offering you New York. Tell him you want Atlanta.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Cuz I want New York.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: You ever put your hands on me again and you'll be doing the books for a baitshop in the fucking Everglades, Mister.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You didn't tell me about Red Deer Table --

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: -- what the hell is Red Deer Table?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What is it? It's genocide, that's what it is. It's a Pay Zone for some U.S. corporation and a Dead Zone for the people here. Uranium, Cooch.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: This was a Selective Operations Unit, Agent Levoi. There is classified information pertaining to our national security. You don't question that, you don't go digging into that shit -- that's insubordination. Jesus Christ --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: -- if they mine uranium there, these people will have no place left to go...

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: We were sworn in on the Constitution to protect federal matters, Ray. I don't know about uranium, I don't know about Red Dog Table -- all I know is we did our job. It's over.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We neutralized anybody with a voice. Leo, Jimmy... Eagle Bear. Anyone who was standing in the way of the land. Is that it?

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: No. We neutralized enemies of the United States. Anti-American radicals who have killed federal officers out here!

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Come on, Ray. Come forward.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No way, Cooch.

turns.speaker: COOCH
turns.text: Ray...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Let the press through.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: I said when can Leo be taken to ceremony?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: After we've completed our investigation.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What are you --

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Watch out!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You're steppin' on sign.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey.  Hey, you, listen up --

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: -- Leo wasn't killed here. He was dumped here. Out of a vehicle. Bald tread. Muffler held on with baling wire.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Big sonuvabuck. Based on the depth of that print, pressure releases... I'd say he goes two-ten, two-fifteen --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: -- Well, maybe two-seventeen.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're trying to tell me you can read all that from a track?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: No. Not just a track. You gotta listen to the trees, man. To the leaves. To this sand, you FBI's kicked all up. You gotta listen to the earth.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Is that right? Well, listen to this: drag your ass. This is a restricted area.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: No, this is the home of the Oglala Sioux and I want the dog-fucker who killed Leo. Whether you get him or I get him, I just want him. Shit's been goin' on too long.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You've got no jurisdiction.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You got no know-how. About Indian Way. Or about Jack Shit for that matter.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Maybe you're not aware of this, Crow Horse, but I just flew in from a place called the Twentieth Century where we have such things as electrostatic tracking methods, psycholingusitics, DNA fingerprinting; I don't have to crawl around with the scorpions and talk to the fucking trees to get answers. Leo was killed right here.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Go back to the M.E., take a look inside Leo's exit wounds and tell me how chicken feed got in there. Trust me, there ain't chickens in the Badlands. His mother's place is --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: -- his mother never lived here. She was from up in North Dakota.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: I'm talkin' his spiritual mother. Maisy Blue Legs.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: His spiritual mother...

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: To us Indians, our spiritual relatives are as close as family. I've got seven mothers on this reservation. Sisters. Brothers. You ain't one of them.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Thank God. Now listen to me, asshole. I'm giving you a break. But if my partner finds out you're here, you're gonna be reading rat tracks in Sioux Falls Maximum Security.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Easy. Easy... I'm goin'.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: You're an easy man to track, Ray. Ya walk like a penguin with a hard-on.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Is that right? What are the trees saying today?

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: They're sayin' that nobody's gonna talk to you cuz they don't give away one of their own. But they did say there's somebody way across the Little Walking River who wants to talk to you.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: He sent me to find ya. He says he's got information.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: CROW HORSE
turns.text: Grandpa Samuel Reaches. Heavy duty medicine.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Medicine. As in medicine man?
